messages.text:
Hey all, just raising a personal opinion here that there was a lot shared today on this AMA from Assad, would be good to have a more digested and practical approach and broadcast it internally in the teams. I can see engineers already interpreting multiple different things from it and it might go in every direction.
I'm sure this is already being processed behind the scenes by our management layer but just wanted to raise the topic :slightly_smiling_face:

messages.text:
Hey folks,
Any thoughts on the *Anomaly Detection?* Would this be something we as NV could easily pick up?  <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C02C8NDMA/p1757936886188899>

elements.text:
[HelloTech Launch Announcement] Introducing Anomaly Detection - Catching Defects from a User’s Perspective

Hey Team!
We’re incredibly excited to
of a powerful new observability tool:

!
This new capability is part of our User Journey Monitoring (UJM) initiative and is designed to catch the “absence of good things” that traditional monitoring often misses. Think about those silent failures where a button is missing, and no error is thrown—these are the incidents that usually take us weeks to detect manually and that have historically cost us millions.
Automatically detect unusual drops in key Google Analytics events, such as “add to cart” or successful logins.
Identify unexpected changes in application metrics, like Istio Request Rate, that could signal a problem.
Monitor the health of business-critical metrics, such as voucher issuance.
For a deeper understanding of how our Anomaly Detection works, please refer to:
If you’re convinced and have a specific use case, setting up Anomaly Detection can be done with a single configuration file. You can find detailed guides for:
Anomaly Detection on Google Analytics (GA) Events
Anomaly Detection on Custom Metrics (“Bring Your Own Metric”)

attachments.fallback:
[September 15th, 2025 4:48 AM] johannes.weissensel: [HelloTech Launch Announcement] Introducing Anomaly Detection - Catching Defects from a User’s Perspective

Hey Team!
We’re incredibly excited to <https://docs.google.com/document/d/11UHsbG-t2eZnvBOoxNmjJAAbG_XkjYpdnsqWmnkwnKQ/edit?tab=t.0|announce the launch> of a powerful new observability tool: *Anomaly Detection* :mag_right:!
This new capability is part of our User Journey Monitoring (UJM) initiative and is designed to catch the “absence of good things” that traditional monitoring often misses. Think about those silent failures where a button is missing, and no error is thrown—these are the incidents that usually take us weeks to detect manually and that have historically cost us millions.

*Here’s how it works:*
• *User Behavior Anomalies:* Automatically detect unusual drops in key Google Analytics events, such as “add to cart” or successful logins.
• *System-Level Anomalies:* Identify unexpected changes in application metrics, like Istio Request Rate, that could signal a problem.
• *Business Activity Metrics:* Monitor the health of business-critical metrics, such as voucher issuance.
*How To Get Started?* :rocket:
For a deeper understanding of how our Anomaly Detection works, please refer to: <https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/metrics-automation/docs/metrics-automation/user-journey-monitoring/anomaly-detection/what-is-anomaly-detection/| Why Use Anomaly Detection?>

*Ready to Implement?*
If you’re convinced and have a specific use case, setting up Anomaly Detection can be done with a single configuration file. You can find detailed guides for:
• <https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/metrics-automation/docs/metrics-automation/user-journey-monitoring/anomaly-detection/ga-anomaly-detection/|Anomaly Detection on Google Analytics (GA) Events>
• <https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/metrics-automation/docs/metrics-automation/user-journey-monitoring/anomaly-detection/custom-metrics-anomaly-detection/|Anomaly Detection on Custom Metrics (“Bring Your Own Metric”)>

Hey Team!
We’re incredibly excited to <https://docs.google.com/document/d/11UHsbG-t2eZnvBOoxNmjJAAbG_XkjYpdnsqWmnkwnKQ/edit?tab=t.0|announce the launch> of a powerful new observability tool: *Anomaly Detection* :mag_right:!
This new capability is part of our User Journey Monitoring (UJM) initiative and is designed to catch the “absence of good things” that traditional monitoring often misses. Think about those silent failures where a button is missing, and no error is thrown—these are the incidents that usually take us weeks to detect manually and that have historically cost us millions.

*Here’s how it works:*
• *User Behavior Anomalies:* Automatically detect unusual drops in key Google Analytics events, such as “add to cart” or successful logins.
• *System-Level Anomalies:* Identify unexpected changes in application metrics, like Istio Request Rate, that could signal a problem.

_thread_replies.text:
Hey Maria, <@U027201FQSV> and team actually already implemented this for GoodChop for some events as part of our wider <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HyYeuaQH7RQtyQsg7Mta_0xQnV5O6Ti8-yHX2PWYJq0/edit?tab=t.0|initiative> for improved debugging of criticals

You can see GoCs dashboard <https://prdhellofresh.grafana.net/d/dpTxA52n0VMFFg8eCFyZeTfyUuntcr0KNDU67A2Q/google-analytics-anomaly-detection?orgId=1&from=2025-09-01T07:33:06.371Z&to=2025-09-02T07:33:06.371Z&timezone=browser&var-metrics_ds=de5wlory5e8lcd&var-platform=$__all&var-country=$__all&var-event_groups=&var-event_name=Addon_FreeAddOnImpression&var-event_name=Load_Funnel_Step_Address&var-event_name=Load_Funnel_Step_Payment&var-event_name=Reactivate_Success&var-event_name=Signup_OrderConfirmation&var-event_name=Voucher_ApplyVoucherNotificationError&var-group_by=platform,%20country,%20brand,%20event_name&var-brand=GoodChop&var-anomaly_direction=both|here>
